description:
8.35 amix
Mixes multiple audio inputs into a single output.

Note that this filter only supports float samples (the amerge
and pan audio filters support many formats). If the amix
input has integer samples then aresample will be automatically
inserted to perform the conversion to float samples.

It accepts the following parameters:
name: amix

options.description: The number of inputs. If unspecified, it defaults to 2.
options.name: inputs

options.description:
How to determine the end-of-stream.

longest

The duration of the longest input. (default)

shortest

The duration of the shortest input.

first

The duration of the first input.
options.name: duration

options.description: The transition time, in seconds, for volume renormalization when an input stream ends. The default value is 2 seconds.
options.name: dropout_transition

options.description: Specify weight of each input audio stream as a sequence of numbers separated by a space. If fewer weights are specified compared to number of inputs, the last weight is assigned to the remaining inputs. Default weight for each input is 1.
options.name: weights

options.description: Always scale inputs instead of only doing summation of samples. Beware of heavy clipping if inputs are not normalized prior or after filtering by this filter if this option is disabled. By default is enabled.
options.name: normalize
